annotation.TEXT: Here's a P-switch. I wonder what it'll do?
Yep, I was expecting an Eerie there, but what about the Big Boo?
Oh, and now the P-switch has expired. Sure had a weirdly long duration.
Oh, wait, there it is. (That's kind of cheap actually.)
Oh, and I suppose the next thing you'll be telling me is that spin jumps destroy Dry Bones, right?
Whoa! Almost got podoboo-ed there! Okay, calm down. I'm just going to eventually get myself killed if I don't stop rushing.

I'm going this way first, and just like before, the control coin was replaced with a 1-up. And, I believe I can get another 1-up by taking the left exit from this room (which is strangely devoid of enemies).
That was a weird little dance I did on the corner there. It started happening when I tried to spin jump. Also, collecting this mushroom put my score above 100K!
Yeah, I figured I'd get hit there, so I'll just rush through.
Okay, it does look like Lemmy's castle, but with Spike Tops instead of Magikoopa.

Anything? No? Maybe the secrets were to the left of the P-switch? Or... maybe I wasn't supposed to hit the P-switch at all? I'll have to come back here another time and figure out what that P-switch really does.
Okay, world 3 is done! What awaits in world 4? Find out next time!
That looks like a tricky jump. Better get running speed.
Yep! Also, I can get another power up, but...
Whoops. Messed that up. Well, I'll just wait for him to wake up while I grab a feather...? Huh, why does that block only give me a mushroom? It's a green ! block in the original game, right?
Well, I'm not going to intentionally fall in, but knowing this game's physics, I'll probably slip and fall at some point. Hmm... I wonder what that P-switch does.
Are there any 1-ups in any of these blocks like in the original game? It's not looking like it.
To be continued...
Done! Why Mario suddenly moves to the left and is running in place is beyond me. Also, the podoboo didn't vanish. I wonder if that could've injured me during the victory music...
Wait a minute... This doesn't look like the Vanilla Ghost House! This looks more like Donut Secret House!
Okay, quick, get in the door before the Boo gets me!
It looks like a properly functioning Lemmy.
Okay, now I think I was told in the comments earlier that "Water = SMB1". Am I to assume that means falling in this water would kill me because it acts like a bottomless pit?
Ah, I'm onto your weird Mario physics now, game!
Umm... What? Why can't I collect these coins? Maybe because they're a hint, but still, why not allow me to collect them?
Dang it. I was careful for that with the first two lava pits, so why wasn't I careful with that lava pit?
Whoa. I'm surprised I was able to skip that block safely.
Wow, though. Being able to completely destroy Dry Bones makes spin jumps more useful than I thought. I still wish I could bounce off of dangerous enemies with them though.
Hello, and welcome back to Super Mario World NES! Now, let's enter the Vanilla Ghost House here...
What?! That wasn't good enough?!
Oh, look. Due to this game's jump physics, I can leap up here no problem, but there's not much to see.
Umm... Well there you go! The Big Boo, ladies and gentlemen!
Ooh, a mushroom. Oh, yeah, and this area obviously doesn't use that layer 2 scrolling. Also, there were some turn block jumps earlier that weren't in the original.
D'oh. Screwed that up.
Wow, it's even got a functional Boo Ring! Although, it is a bit slow...
I still wish this thing moved faster though.
Argh! Yep, that stupid hitbox issue is true to the original game, so I can't fault this game for that. That's two stomps now, though.
I guess I'll just fireball the wall while I wait here.
Demo count: 7

It created a platform and revealed a hidden door, kind of as expected. (The P-switch back in Yoshi's Island 2 also created a platform that I used to cross a pit. I just didn't realize the platform was summoned by the P-switch at first.)
I'm not sure what that P-switch did, actually. I'm not seeing a hidden door or a platform that looks like one that a P-switch would summon. Also, hey, guess what? I didn't fall into the water!
Oh, yeah. You can run over 1-tile wide gaps in this game with no problem, as it should be. (This probably wasn't the best place to test this out though, but at least I didn't die.)
No way. Seriously, that worked?! This game's Mario physics, man. I don't know what to say about them anymore.
Push!
Gotcha! That's one. And it looks like you get 200 points whether you stomp the real one or a fake, and regardless of which type of jump you use.
Hmm... Is there no midpoint? Oh, right, it's normally in a side area that you need the P-switch for. Did I somehow miss it or something?
Patience FTW this time!
Aaaggg!!! Laaaggg!!!
Alright, who's the boss this time?
Level complete!
Okay, most of these things seem to be in the right places. There was no P-switch or springboard in the previous room, but it's not like I needed them.
Now, let's see... I couldn't make this jump while small, so I certainly won't be able to make it if I attempt the same thing while big... But, then how? Maybe I just run across?
Bah, more waiting. Oh, maybe I shouldn't be shooting fireballs, as it makes the game lag. (It's interesting that it can even manage this many sprites without lagging though!)
No Boo Ring here?
And now for the castle. Will this actually be Lemmy's castle? Or will it somehow actually be another level from Donut Plains?
That podoboo could've taken me by surprise if I was rushing more.
Semi-intentional hit. I got bored and wanted out of here. (Don't know why I didn't at least make an attempt to slip through the Boos to the left though.)
What? The P-switch is still in effect? Wow. Oh, and is there a door way up here now?
And since I didn't hit a midpoint, I gotta do the entire first half again...

Even worse, I missed my exit opportunity! But, wow, I'm counting 13 sprites here (12 Boos plus Mario)! How many other NES games out there can have this many sprites at all? Oh, and if I shoot two fireballs, that increases the sprite count to 15!
...Wow, really? I was only joking! Alright, then... next you'll be telling me I can walk on lava! ...Wait, that's already been disproven. I'll have to think of something more clever than that.
Stupid podoboo got in my way there...
Nope. Still no door there.
Okay, I'm going to pay more attention here in case I missed something.
